website_summaries.verdict: A deceptively large smoker with 6 height-adjustable grates that offers an impressive 1,890 sq. in. of total cooking area.
pros: The design of this wide-body smoker allows you to cook a variety of food while capturing the maximum amount of flavor
of food at once and the porcelain-enameled offset charcoal chamber can provide maintenance-free cooking for hours at a time
cons: The lower door latch can be awkward to access, and some models arrive with slight dents that may allow smoke and heat to escape

customer_reviews.title: For Experienced Meat Smoker, I am Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with this smoker. Had been in meat business for about 15 years and have smoked thousands pounds of sausage and meats. This little smoker kept the temperature in freezing weather and put out great smoke. I would recommend this one above others to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Guy M. Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Looks solider then it is
customer_reviews.text: My hopes were higher then the smoker was able to meet ! I did put it together alone and it did take about 30 plus min. I did use a food grade sealer like I saw on a you tube video and the dang thing still leaks smoke ! I even had to seal inside around the top was a gap as well as around the door seal. I made a video and the smoker is not as heavy as it is awkward and dents very easy. I do hope it stands the test of time but not sure on that..
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomerUSA

customer_reviews.title: :DO NOT BUY" very thin metal and missing all of the screws and nuts required to assemble the unit.
customer_reviews.text: After waiting to Dyna-Glo for about a week, it finally arrived. During the process of unloading the unit from the box, I realized that the unit was made of very thin metal, I was not too concerned, what really got me upset was that after removing all of the parts for assembly, all of the screws and nuts required to assemble the unit was missing, that spokes volume about the quality control that the manufacture has. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: SDH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get hot enough
customer_reviews.text: This smoker would not get to temp. It struggled to get to 200 degrees and I was able to get it to 210 degrees once. I have an accurate temperature gauge that showed the stock one was fairly accurate (within 5 degrees) and I also confirmed with an infrared thermometer. I've tried multiple times to cook with this unit, but I have had zero success. Was able to put this item together rather easy in less than 20 minutes, but overall a waste of money because I am unable to cook with it. I would look for a different smoker If i were you.
customer_reviews.author: brian rhoades

customer_reviews.title: Missing Hardware packet
customer_reviews.text: Today was the first rain and decided it was a good day to open and assemble my new Dyna-Glo indirect smoker BUT the hardware for assembling was missing. Just contacted manufacturer waiting for a reply. Will update when hardware is received. Not happy I have to wait to complete this project. The manufacturer got back to me asking for serial number and receipt. Do they think I am going to scam them over some screws and a C-clip? Awaiting parts will update when they arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Goddur

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Please if you could avoid buying this product I would suggest that, I got this product everything was in the box except for the hardware to put it together. I have a party within a couple days that’s the reason why I bought it ...call the manufacturer They said will be more than happy to send it within 5 to 7 business days which is unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: Felo Z

customer_reviews.title: Here is what I found.
customer_reviews.text: One star is probably to much for this. Both doors do not seal and leak badly. Unit was bent in box and not from shipping but from cheap steal. Had to straighten the doors and smoke chamber. Sealed both compartments with high temp silicone, not included. Fire box damper does not slide properly and was missing screws. Damper on smoke chamber assembly is put together with an aluminum rivet and broke on seasoning of the unit. Temp control is impossible due to lack of air restriction. Do not recommend this unit for serious smokers.
customer_reviews.author: william h newton

customer_reviews.title: I really like this smoker, tremendous value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase. I read a lot of reviews of this and other smokers. When I assembled it I sealed every crack and crevice with silicon, using a flashlight to check. I added door seals to both the fire box and the smoke chamber. Put a complete coating of peanut oil allover the inside before burning two bags of regular briquetts for the curing. I've smoked in it 3 times so far, again, extremely happy. I can see a few mods I would like to do in the future but those in no way take away from the value of this smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Art Harris

customer_reviews.title: Delivery issuses hope it works
customer_reviews.text: Just received my smoker today, has a significant dent in the smoker itself and a small ding on the fire box door. I don't want to send it back because we are supposed to use it for a BBQ father's day weekend please make a note to your delivery provider that this is unacceptable... I didn't spend good money on a dented smoker . Hopefully it will work just fine.🤬😡
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Moore

customer_reviews.title: The large shipping box is difficult to handle.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in one large box. There's not much to assemble really. The firebox bolts to the smoker cabinet, which is complete minus the door. The legs attach to the bottom of both boxes. The chimney bolts on the top of the smoker. Firebox door has a handle on it from the factory, just hang the door on the firebox. The door of the smoker needs it's handle and latches attached, and then hung on the smoker body. I noticed only a small dent in the bottom corner of the smoker body. It may have left the factory that way.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy G

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Father’s Day Gordy for the husband and he loves it! We have done burgers, brats, ribs, pork loin and fish so far....everything has been great! Doing a pork butt for the 4th, have no doubts it will turn out great as well! Great buy....do wish the cover would have been in stock as we have to move it into shed every time we are done. So far we have only used fresh mulberry wood (from a tree we cut down) and charcoal but have ordered some other chips can’t wait to try them! Great value for the money. You can good so many different things at one time!
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an anniversary gift for my spouse. I should have done it years ago, because this gift has really been the best. For some reason my husband truly enjoys babysitting pork butts, briskets and ribs.... He comes into the house smelling like hickory or mesquite woods, I’m having to cook Way less, the meat he smokes is delicious .....and to be super honest he’s just never seemed manlier to me. It’s also a good time to be doing the keto diet up in here.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gagel

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker but needed mods.
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, got it on sale at Amazon. Fortunately, I received mine with no dings/dents and with the screws, nuts and bolts all accounted for. With few mods (gaskets, sealant, extra temp. gauge, probe grommets and a double coat of Rust-Oleum high heat spray paint) you got a winner. It's no competition smoker, but for avid weekend warrior smoker it does the job and it does it good. I highly recommend the product and with a few modifications you'll be rewarded. Happy smoking...
customer_reviews.author: IslandWarrior

customer_reviews.title: GOOD VALUE FOR $$
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be well made for entry level smoker, very easy to assemble. Arrived via UPS in PERFECT condition! Per other users on various websites, I installed high temp gasketing on both doors as well as high temp RTV on all metal to metal connections. I have only done the initial "seasoning" burn in but was able to control temp in the "smoking range" at minimal draft setting and exhaust damper in most closed position - I have seen videos where others have had to modify exhaust damper to allow more control, we'll see one I get smoking ! Putting a mobile machine base under this to allow some movement
customer_reviews.author: PaSkiDog

customer_reviews.title: they are very nice. Was informed it could take up to ten ...
customer_reviews.text: Recieved smoker but the screws where missing to put smoker together. Called GHP Group customer support to get screws, they are very nice. Was informed it could take up to ten (10) days to arrive. I recieved a 77lb smoker in 2 days but a set of screws weighing less than 1lb takes 10 days. Have an event to cook for now I have to borrow a smoker. 4/23/18 update: recieved the screws to put the grill together. Looks beautiful Finally smoked some salmon and chicken. The smoker performed great. I was able to control the temp, very easy to add more wood
customer_reviews.author: Seben Griffin

customer_reviews.title: No instructions, screws or bolts
customer_reviews.text: Package came and a number of parts were missing, including screws and nuts. Thanks to Google, I found the instructions PDF, but the missing parts were an issue. Won't be buying anything from Dyna-Glo again.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: No Screws included
customer_reviews.text: when I began to assemble my smoker I noticed there were no screws or bolts in my box. Kinda makes it hard to assemble and use the smoker. I hope this is a rare mistake that doesn't happen often as now I have to find 32 screws to assemble my smoker.
customer_reviews.author: curtiss jackson

customer_reviews.title: Once you learn temperature swings of your fuel should be GTG.
customer_reviews.text: Could be a little thicker gauge construction and tighter damper door on firebox. Love not having to open meat locker side when adding fuel mid-cook. Ran it up hot at first until I found happy place for my mesquite and pecan fuel combo. Was easy to keep between 230-260 degrees after that. Firebox holds a lot of fuel. A small blower fan with bluetooth control would make a great addition. Can also cook on top of offset firebox. Did a #10 can of Ranch Style Beans at the end of cook. So far, So good. The compliments and groans from overstuffed bellies full of pork butt and brisket makes it all worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: It was a great purchase. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after reading many reviews. Put it together and did some modification (not much). Maybe thirty dollars worth. It was a great purchase. Works great. Before you rip the box apart actually grab the directions, sit down and have a beer and relax This fifteen minutes crap is crazy. Maybe after putting together ten of them fifteen minutes is more than possible, but we aren't buying ten. I found that it is a good unit, not the best but, for the money better than many Cold weather smoking is probably out of the question but summer smoking will be fine Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Francis

customer_reviews.title: 2 stars if used out of box. 4 stars when if modified.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a year round hobby smoker and I can definitely recommend this smoker if you purchase it and some sealant and gasket. It's a good size for weekend smoking although the manufacturing isn't so great. Some screw holes do not line up properly although it does not appear to affect the ability to smoke foods. Pros: good size, fire box is large enough for wood only burning. Lots of racks for lots of foods. Cons: out of the box it does not come well sealed so adding some sealant and gaskets are a must. Leaks between the fire box and smoke box. Doors leak, thermometer leaks, handles leak. Once fixed it holds up well and produces good smoke ability.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bear

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Need to look up about modifications as I spent another 100 on upgrading something but I researched a lot of smokers as I don't have the money to my a really nice one that would run me 2000 or more. This is a great setup and with a few modifications and their are alot of sites with lists of what is needed to trick out your smoker. I will add that one thing I added was a small speed controlled blower that is made for smoking that helps give extra airflow when needed. Helps bring it back up to temp after adding wood or opening the door. Has brought my smoking to another level.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Sage

customer_reviews.title: Can’t trust door temperature reading
customer_reviews.text: My biggest takeaway of the smoker as of right now is the huge difference in temperature between the thermometer that came with the smoker and my wireless unit. Assembly was pretty easy and straightforward, we careful not to over tighten the screws it will break. I also follow the advice of others and added a door seal and sealant and all welds and gaps
customer_reviews.author: Carnell

customer_reviews.title: Just okay for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: First, let me start by saying that the smoker did not come with the 32 required M6-12mm screws required to assemble it, the additional cost to purchase them from Home Depot and Lowes was about $12.60. Assembly is relatively simple and took about 30 minutes with the proper tools on hand. The meat box itself is made of thin material but seems to hold up well, the fire box is somewhat stronger. Lastly, if your serious about smoking then you are going to need to apply gasket material around the door to create a better seal.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: a very good product. Definitely a good smoker for a first-timer
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price, a very good product. Definitely a good smoker for a first-timer. Go ahead and buy the fireproof caulk and smoker seal tape to help seal everything up. It leaks around the thermometer (shown on the front), cooking chamber door, and firebox door. Also, it's made out of very light gauge steel, but after modifications it will make some great BBQ and other foods. After you get through learning curve of how to use it, holding a constant temperature is easy. We use it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Roes

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Although it didnt matter structuraly product arrived with a couple dents. Paint peeled off firebox upon 1st use i just used some heatproof paint. Seems like it requires alot of fuel and alot of monitoring to maintain heat but i havent sealed it yet and it is a bit drafty. All that being said its the best smoker for the price and seems to cook very well. Great product for someone who enjoys smoking/grilling in the backyard and looking to experiment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It makes everyone happy except neighbors
customer_reviews.text: I got this toy for my husband for fathers day and its probably the best present he's ever had. He is very happy with this smoker, makes the most delicious meals. The best part is that there are so many things you can make in it. We cant wait for our next food adventure. We have made, smoked fish, brisket, pork belly and looking forward to many more. Love it and appreciate it. the only thing we did not get the cover, the wide one for some reason did not come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Masha Godzhik

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Maybe.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived dented, severely deters me from ordering this product on Amazon. Pros: with a little learning curve and investing in a wireless temp reader this smoker will get the job done Cons: eats hardwood like a mofo! I expect that it would be slightly less gluttons if it had a tight seal. Even if mine wasn't manhandled by amazon it would still have a bunch of leaks from the welding job. More investments to make this product make me realize I should have just bought a slightly higher priced model... too late, gotta buy some smoker sealer...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Warren

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews - its a great smoker for starting out on the journey
customer_reviews.text: Wife got this for me last summer. Read the reviews, and got a gasket for the door and sealant that I used while assembling. Simple to put together, and I didn't have any issues with condition of the parts or box when it was delivered. There is a learning curve. What fuel to use, what to use for smoke, how to treat the meat/fish before smoking. Nothing you won't find out about by doing a little research around the web. So far I've done ribs, chicken, and fish. My next project this spring will be a beef brisket which can take 14 to 18 hours. Got to prepare for that one. Overall, I've been very satisfied with the smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get something else
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. After buying this and using it for several months, I have decided that it would have been better to get an egg shaped, ceramic smoker instead. This thing leaks smoke like it’s being paid to do it. Even with buying seals and lining the edges of everywhere, it still leaks which means air is getting in and causing the heat to rise.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfs Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Large Smoker Box!
customer_reviews.text: I decided on this type of smoker after doing a lot of research and I assembled it I noticed that the door was not level but it still sealed well enough to still be able to use it. I have used it 3 different times and it has worked out very well. Brisket and a Pork Butt and several racks of Pork Spare Ribs. The fire box could be a little larger for me but still works well. I only use Hardwood Lump Charcoal with no additives or chemicals and Have used Several types of wood for that great smoky flavor. Recommend for someone who is looking for a beginner smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this unit to anyone!
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought me this smoke, and I've waited to write a review until I had some time to use it several times. If you follow other instructions and seal this unit, it works rather well. The Thermometer on the unit I received was broke when I received it. However I just replaced it rather than return it. I keep the unit outside, under roof on my back patio. It sees some weather, and the finish has held up quite well over the past months. It holds temperature good, and the fire box is good size. I'm very happy with this unit in terms of quality. Would recommend it to anyone interested in getting into back yard smoking!
customer_reviews.author: Jhritz2000

customer_reviews.title: Very much worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker. Lots of room and works great. Definately get a cover, because if left out for short periods in the rain some parts rust quickly. Also, buy a bbq gasket and caulking to properly seal the smoker door and a couple spots where smoke escapes (Some reviewers are needlessly harsh. No big deal to seal it, and if you tigheten the two chambers properly, there is no smoke loss between the smoker box and fire box). I haven’t touched my charcoal BBQ since getting this. Made lots of delicious food.
customer_reviews.author: JaneDoe

customer_reviews.title: Fair Smoker that could be great....
customer_reviews.text: The smoker is a decent smoker but don't expect to hear back from manufacturer about any problems or suggestions. Expect to spend extra for high heat gasket set and high heat silicone to seal all of the places that smoke leaks out (heat loss) and heat control issues. If the seal kit works as I have read in previous reviews I will consider giving 3 stars. They just need to address some very minor design flaws and this would be a top rate entry level smoker (because of their use of such light gauge metal for especially the firebox and the upright smoker to firebox interface.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D. Wallace Sr.

customer_reviews.title: I completed the recommended upgrades. Plus installed wheels on the smoker end
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing all the reviews I purchased the smoker. I completed the recommended upgrades. Plus installed wheels on the smoker end. During my first smoke I had trouble keeping the temperature up, so I stoked the fire box with dry wood chips, bad idea. My turkeys turned into burnt offerings. My mistake. After rereading the instructions on my next smoke I will allow the charcoal to burn to white than add wet wood chips. I am sure I will love this smoker once I get it figured out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Merkley

customer_reviews.title: Freaking. Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: You picked this smoker because it was the least expensive. I get it. For the beginner, such as myself, this is more than perfect and I couldn't ask for anything better. It provides quality smoking for a fraction of the price. I highly recommend this to anyone and everyone who is interested in learning how to smoke. It's easy, affordable, and manly as hell. Nothing beats cooking with live fire.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Decent smoker for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just a few points about this smoker: 1) the metal is thin, so this smoker is best suited for use during warmer weather cooking, 2) since it is an offset smoker, you will be adding wood/charcoal every 1-2 hrs for long smokes. If you're new to smoking, I would not recommend this one. If you have been smoking a while, this is a good choice if you're looking to smoke a lot at one time (brisket and a few racks of ribs) and don't want to spend a lot . The offset chamber makes it easy to add wood/charcoal without having to open the cabinet where the meat is cooking.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT

customer_reviews.title: This is a good deal
customer_reviews.text: I give it four stars. It's easy, very easy to use. I hired a guy to put it together, but I just do that on larger items. I think it's pretty basic to assemble. My only complaint is this: there's not very good temperature controls. The only thing you can use to adjust it is the ONE side baffle, and a millimeter of adjustment can cause too much variation. But the price is great, and I've turned out some really good stuff on it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Salter

customer_reviews.title: Needs door gaskets
customer_reviews.text: Not bad smoker for the price. On first test run I lost heat constantly due to both doors released smoke constantly. fun times trying to control heat. Save yourself the time and buy gasket material for bbq pits/smokers. Mine works much better now after sealing the doors up all the way around. The lower ash catch-can could be easier to remove but besides that not bad for price for smaller smokers.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace a Brinkman, side by side smoker. I have only used this once so far but it worked very well. Did a brisket and turkey and both turned out nicely. The biggest thing I noticed is that it seemed to take way less fuel than other smokers I have used. I used a mixture of briquettes, chunk charcoal, and wood chunks. Keeping a constant temp was a bit of a challenge for me but I will attribute that to being a novice with this particular smoker. All in all I am extremely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jbrannan

customer_reviews.title: Biggest bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This smoker replaces my barrel smoker. Fire box appears small but with the right vent adjustments the wood burns nice and slow so not bad to replenish. Hard to keep at temperature in the winter when below freezing. Would have liked to have one more vent on the side for even more adjustability but overall very good. Not latching the top latch on the door helps with this. Tons of space with many racks and hooks. You can't go wrong with the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is a great purchase. This is my first smoker and I was looking for something that was cost and space effective. Thing this is certainly both of these. The only thing I recommend is getting a separate thermometer as the one it comes with is not accurate which seems to be a common issue with lower budget grills and smokers. I've used this thing just about every other week for two months and it still looks brand new. The paint on the fire box hasn't started peeling yet either, although some has on the inside which was expected.
customer_reviews.author: James Musick

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, great value
customer_reviews.text: Previously purchased a cheaper smoker from Amazon that came damaged, leaked smoke, and had an uneven heat source that burned half of the food and left the other half undercooked. I returned it for this one and I am very happy with my decision to switch. The build is heavy duty and it maintains its temperature with minimal effort. The cooking chamber is huge. In one sitting I smoked a whole turkey, a rack of ribs, two pork tenderloins and an entire rack of sausages with space to spare. There are more advanced and more expensive smokers on the market but this is the best unit in its price range on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: cristina

customer_reviews.title: Small offset charcoal box/burner.
customer_reviews.text: I like the smoker but here is some cons and pros. Cons. the attached charcoal grill could've been 1 and half times bigger as you need to keep putting wood/charcoal more often than the smaller smoker if you are cooking lots of meet (hence a wider smoker). Can't use logs but only small chunks of wood Pros. Wide smoker so you can fit lots of food on one shelf *6 shelfs
customer_reviews.author: D.P

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker for the price but a bit dryer than my vertical one.
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer in the door reads about 40 degrees cooler than my digital probe and an oven thermometer so it may be faulty. Seasoned it yesterday with Pam and smoked some ribs this afternoon. Worked great and held temperature well, kept the side vent almost closed and toggling the to vent for control. Following others I used the red silicon between the fire and smoker box and the tape around the firebox door. In addition I got an 11x15 aluminum pan for water, 1.5" probe grommet, and welding blankets for winter.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this upgrade to my "pill" charcoal smoker. After 3 uses I will throw it away. Heat distribution. The meat cabinet ambient heat is 100 degrees hotter on one side vs the other. All the heat travels up the side near the fire box. Not sealed well, not fluted well. I can't control the heat of the fire because dampers are ineffective. It's either way too hot or not hot enough. Without heat control the point of smoking meat is totally lost. Don't buy this smoker. I will find another that is sealed well, has sufficient dampers, and not an offset fire box.
customer_reviews.author: Karl F.

customer_reviews.title: It is not particular efficent in controling the burn
customer_reviews.text: I holds a fair amount of food. It does not heat particularly even ( for jerky) so the temp is not dependable . And trying to control the burn, not happening. I made multiple physical modifications otherwise I would have returned it or given it away. I like jerky and it requires control. If you are just doing maybe a single piece of meet it would be ok
customer_reviews.author: Don Cobble

customer_reviews.title: First Class design and construction
customer_reviews.text: When the box arrived I dragged it into the garage to build out. My wife, who loves to wrench could not wait to get ther hands on it. It took her 2 hours to do a first class job of assembly. Aside from am little dent on the chamber we could not be more thrilled with the price and the purchase. Can't wait to thow down a brisket.
customer_reviews.author: abb3y

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little smoker.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent smoker for the price. The materials used to manufacture it keep the price low, but because of this you must must must take preventative measures during assembly. First, seal with high heat silicone caulk during assembly and after to prevent smoke loss. Second, use "lavalock" bbq gasket tape to keep the main smoker door sealed during cooking. Lastly line the interior of the main smoker with aluminum foil to keep it clean, and always use a drip pan with water. If you use an exterior cover all of this should make it last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good smoker for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good smoker for the price. Do your research first! This does suffer from some leakage in certain spots, and it will take a bit of trial and error to get your temperature squared away. I made sure to order some Food Grade RTV High Heat Silicone Be aware that you really cant fit a whole rack of ribs - you will have to half them to fit. Other than that, I have had everything from pork shoulder and chicken, to my 18lb Thanksgiving Turkey in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F. Soder

customer_reviews.title: Be patient in learning the smoker
customer_reviews.text: I like what you get for the money and that you can keep it outside even if you have dogs. (Nothing to chew on) Both times I smoked with it, it poured down rain and I couldn’t keep the temp wher I wanted it. Rain will absolutely bring The temp down 50 or 75 degrees. Goosemeat would have tasted better if I’d been able to sustain it about 250degrees. Tenderized deer is so wonderfully delicious smoked with Chupacabra rub.
customer_reviews.author: Drywall guy

customer_reviews.title: Practice, practice, practice
customer_reviews.text: So I gave it 4 stars across the board, here's why. It's a little flimsy. There were a few dents when I unpacked it, but nothing I couldn't straighten out, or choose enough. It's hard to judge how much wood to use and it's easy to over heat. There is a vent in the burn box and it has a chimney with flap. But not the easiest to manipulate into gettingbdesired temp., probably takes a lot more experience. But once you get the hang of it, it works like a champ. It was very easy to assemble and only took 1/2 hour or so. All in all it is pretty Damn great for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: With a little work it is amazing
customer_reviews.text: ******ASTERICK********* First grill came 100% dented/damaged. Had to return (had to do, very heavy). Second smoker came in perfect condition. Please if you buy this smoker take the time to buy: High temp Silicone; Gasket & Temperature gauges. The stock one is crap and the seal is non-existent for smoking (this is why it is cheap). Spend the extra $30 to create a good seal (inside and around doors) and you will easily have a $500.00 smoker. (see my pictures) not a grill master yet but out of the box this probably wont do much at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best smoker for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This a good smoker. Plenty of room to smoke 5 whole chickens at a time. Only one issue with the fire box allowing flames to get into the smoker chamber. I fixed that by making a flame shield out of a piece of aluminum to divert the flames front and back, to keep the meat on the bottom rack wouldn't get chard, cost me about a dollar. Other then that it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this smoker
customer_reviews.text: Love this smoker! Have used it many times. Very highly recommended for an entry level enthusiast or for someone who has been smoking meats for a long time. We have used this smoker about 10 times so far and it seems to be holding up very well. I will say, I did use high temp RTV upon assembly to ensure that the gaps were all sealed off. I also purchased some high temp smoker gasket to seal off the door. With a few small modifications, ​this smoker is well worth the money. 12/14/17
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Good Smoker for Backyard Weekend Smoking
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner at smoking, but I find this easy to use and produces very satisfying results. Assembly was easy enough for one person (but better to have two) and the directions we're clear. It takes some practice and trial and error to figure out temperature control, but that's kind of the fun part. As a beginner, I think it's been a perfect smoker to learn different techniques on. Probably good for more advanced users too. Should I become really proficient I may upgrade to a more serious device.
customer_reviews.author: S. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: I love this smoker
customer_reviews.text: I love this smoker! I looked at a lot of models before deciding which one I was going to purchase. Unit arrived in perfect condition, only issue was thermometer was pegged out, but a tap of the finger on the back and it went back to normal. While putting it together I used others reviews and their minor issues they had and corrected them before the first use. I sealed all joints with food grade RTV and added Nomex stripping onto the doors. Everything sealed up awesome. Put it together Saturday, seasoned it and cooked Sunday. Ribs, shoulder and wings. Food was fantastic. I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants a great smoker for the weekend BBQ'er.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: A smoking delight!
customer_reviews.text: Since getting this wonderful smoker, we have been making some darn tasty food. I think the design of having the heat source off to the side provides a much better means of smoking and controlling the temperature than having the heat source directly under the food. So glad we purchased this smoker!
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Mitton III

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to assemble even though there was quite a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to smoke a turkey for Christmas. It was easy to assemble even though there was quite a bit to assemble. It looks just like the picture, which is really nice. We easily and successfully smoked a 12 lbs turkey in it. I do recommend removing all the arms and tray inserts that you don't need when using the smoker. This makes clean-up much quicker. Be sure to follow the cleaning instrructions, too!
customer_reviews.author: KathiLong

customer_reviews.title: How close the opening chamber is to the bottom grate.
customer_reviews.text: Came dented in two spots. Amazon was amazingly quick to offer a credit that was worth while for the damages. Will have to seal obvious gaps. Haven't smoke with it yet. Easy to assemble. Opening from the smoker box to the chamber is right in line with the bottom grate. Definitely needs a buffer plate. It would have been smart to just make it another 6 inches taller to allow for easier conversion for the buffer plate or to have a little extra space for heat to travel before heating whatever you are smoking.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Pilarski

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the included temperature gauge. My ribs came ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't trust the included temperature gauge. My ribs came out burt because the gauge was only reading much lower than the actual temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality workmanship and design.
customer_reviews.text: Pieces fit together well but I recommend using the high-temp sealant and self-adhesive sealing strip for doors and seams because I did and it really helps to control the smoke. I followed the directions in the manuel (well written and useful) and was very pleased. After curing the paint as suggested, my first smoked pork roasts came out perfectly. The offset design is great. I maintained the perfect cooking temperature without a lot of attention because the venting worked well. I would recommend this smoker to a friend without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Hallpal

customer_reviews.title: Dyna-glo charcoal offset smoker.
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes it. On cooler days we had to add a heat resistant blanket to help keep the heat in. He has commented a couple of times he wished he had gotten the wider smoker. A slab of ribs is too big for the width of the smoker shelf. Can cut in half and they fit. The vents don't close enough to lower the heat when it gets too hot. Need more time to work with the smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO hardware
customer_reviews.text: No hardware. It came with 4 loose nuts & bolts, that’s it. I searched through everything twice. Nothin. Also has a deep dent in side of the taller box. Will be calling customer service tomorrow to get parts. Not worried about the dent as I’m just gonna use the hell out of this thing and scratch it up anyways, but no hardware? Come on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Pyne

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and no seals
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with the seals for the fire box or the smoking area, hard to keep temp controlled and burns wood and charcoal up very quickly, cannot close flap on top all the way to hold in smoke, has gaps all the way around that lets out heat and smoke, made with very cheap materials.
customer_reviews.author: Customer247

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be aware of warranty and options if a problem occurs.
customer_reviews.text: Black powder coat is bubbling and rubbing off after owning the smoker for 13 days! I’m not happy and I’m very disappointed in the GHB group‘s (manufacturer) options for correcting the problem. I’m hoping that this isn’t a common problem with the coating.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It smokes what I put in there.
customer_reviews.text: You have to add wood every 20-30 minutes, so this probably isn't practical for something like a large brisket. It has some leaky spots that I could probably fill, but mostly it's just a small firebox (you can't put split logs, only the fist sized chunks) and if you get too much fuel in there it just gets too hot. Chicken, ribs, bologna, all that stuff comes out pretty good if you stay on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: timr

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and won't hold heat
customer_reviews.text: A little unhappy with the condition of the product and poor manufacturing quality. Received unit with 3-4 large dents within all the protective packaging which tells me that it shipped like that from factory. The assembly was ok, but no way was it the suggested 15 minutes. Once built, I seasoned smoker and noticed during this there were a tremendous amount of gaps in the smokers seams. I had to spend an additional $30.00 on RTV sealant and gasket material to get to hold temperature. Overall dissatisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scott House

customer_reviews.title: u get one of the best BBQs u can get out there
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews, took some pointers and 1. bought myself a $6 tape to wrap around the leaky edges 2. a $12 BBQ cover since it did not come with a cover (didnt care about which type) and guess what, for $150 plus the $18 extra, u get one of the best BBQs u can get out there. And true, at an average temp of 175 degrees, it cooks slow and eats up a bit of charcoal since it is a relatively bigger unit. So thanks, reviewers, or being bang on the little tweaks.
customer_reviews.author: Fiif

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this smoker. There is a 3/16 gap on back side where the fire box meets the main compartment due to materials not being aligned properly when welded . The fire box is just tack welded in place so looking in you can see daylight on every side of the fire box. Maybe I just got a lemon but I would recommend spending the money on a better unit I will be sending it back ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Good first time smoker. Read the reviews! You will need a gasket.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in a timely manor. It was fairly straightforward to put together right or if the box. It only took about 15 minutes. I noticed when assembling it that some of the "guides" that hold the grates only fit in one side or the other. I have used it twice with his results, but have found that some of the other reviews are correct. This smoker is very difficult to keep the temp below 300 deg. The other reviews suggest adding a gasket. I have purchased gasket and will update after I have used it several times to ensure that corrected the problem. Otherwise this is a good purchase for a first time smoker.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dewitt

customer_reviews.title: Dyna-Glo Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the smoker. For the price you cant beat it. Took a total of 30-45 min to assemble everything. One thing that did make me a little unhappy was the dents in the door to the meat box. They are 1/2 inch in size. One at the top left of the door and one at the bottom right of the door. They did effect the way the door seals but with some smoker gasket it will be remedied. Also the temp gauge that came with mine was very accurate. I used my oven temp gauge and put it in the smoke to see any discrepancy and there were none.
customer_reviews.author: Hank & Steph

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you seal it up.
customer_reviews.text: Did the recommended mods and now have smoked salmon and a pork butt. This inexpensive smoker works very well with chunk coal and large wood chunks. The salmon was perfect and well received by friends. The cost of this smoker dictates what you should never do with it. Its a great product for the money. Very happy. I also own a green egg and a weber summit. Both cost 10 times what this unit does. I love the weber and the komado but indirect gives more smoke flavor.
customer_reviews.author: jamming

customer_reviews.title: Great once it arrived and I bought hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker once it showed up but had to go buy hardware. Smoker showed up late neither Amazon nor UPS wants to take responsibility on it. But once unpacked and as I was organizing the parts I noticed there was no hardware in the box, had to run up to the hardware store and buy $30 in screws and snap ring so I could put it together. I siliconed and felted all the joints and doors like recommend. Cured the smoker as recommended then started my first batch of marlin, came out great smoker seems to keep a steady temperature. Really like the vertical box can cook alot more at once.
customer_reviews.author: brandon puckett

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but read reviews
customer_reviews.text: I had read reviews and had no great expectations for this. I bought so lava lock sealer and door strips in advance. I did my burn out on it and checked all the temperatures. With this smoker you have to rotate whatever you are smoking to ensure even cooking. There is also no water tub, but I fixed that with a cast iron dutch oven that had legs.
customer_reviews.author: ryan sevart

customer_reviews.title: Smokes good,with some inconvenience
customer_reviews.text: This smoker really smokes good, but I have some issues that could be better. The latches are inconvenient, the one on the bottom is a pain.The charcoal/wood box needs to be a little bigger and be able to pull it out without the worry of it falling. There should be and access in the side of the smoker so you can run a probe through it.I gave it 4 stars but really to me it's 3 1/2...
customer_reviews.author: Don J Torre

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a smoker!
customer_reviews.text: This smoker is a good value. It was easy to put together and I used silicone to attach the firebox and handles. I paid extra for a gasket and attached it to the larger door on the smoking chamber. It's a good smoker for a fair price. I suppose if I decide to compete in smoking food events I might get something fancier.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It’s an okay smoker.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good smoker, it’s a little overpriced for the amount of work that is needed to make it an acceptable smoker. Read reviews and all the mods noted are really a necessity, this thing leaks smoke like a sieve if you don’t seal the holes and doors. If you’re not a handy person this is not for you. Mine came with a bunch of dents and dings, a few had to be re aligned with hammering. Again with the amount of money needed to make this a good smoker, it’s not for he faint of smokers.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: So I would give it 5 stars if not for the modifications that need to be made I read the reviews and sealed the seems with high temp silicone after that it works great however if I were to buy it again I would have bought the larger size it’s big enough to do most things however a little more space never hurts
customer_reviews.author: stephil400

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I’m just getting started with smoking and so far I’m very happy with this smoker. I did add a lavaLock gasket to the smoke box and chimney along with a small amount of lavaLock sealer. I still see some smoke escaping from both doors so I may had a gasket to them as well but overall very happy. They only issues were a small ding on the door which I think happened in shipping and two of the four screws were missing from the slider on the side smoker for airflow but it’s hasn’t been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bwatson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: It fell apart after only a month! Totally dissatisfied. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level vertical smoker
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a pretty good smoker. Just like every smoker, it has its quirks, but the design is good. if you plan to smoke brisket, or even full rib racks DO NOT get the regular model, get the wide body model. You will want to use a high temp silicone sealant to seal up the connection between the charcoal box and the smoker cavity.
customer_reviews.author: JPenaflor

customer_reviews.title: NO HARDWARE, NO MANUAL, NO SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: Asked to overnight parts. been waiting 4 days. Have smoker half in Kitchen half in Livingroom and no way to put it together. Would send it back, but i live alone and barely go it in the house by myself. And it has dents, but I do not even care about that. I just want to use it...
customer_reviews.author: Jill Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a better smoker for the price. It's big and comes with a lot of racks so no worries on being able to feed family and friends. You will have to learn how to manage temps manually but personally I find that as part of the fun. I wouldn't trust the built in thermometer and recommend getting digital ones you can leave in the smoker. Not that the built in one doesn't work, just any built in thermometer is going to be off a little. I used this smoker to cook chili for a local contest and won so I can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it’ll work better for you
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t get up to temperature easily. Especially if f you’re using charcoal briquettes. Lump coal works better. However I still to use a fan to help it get to or pass 200 degrees. Also it has no wheels so it’s not easy to move for one person. You have to space your meat out pretty well or the temperature will not budge. If you can get it close to 300 it cooks great.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Gallashaw Jr

customer_reviews.title: I love my smoker
customer_reviews.text: When I received my smoker I was shocked that the delivery person dropped it on my porch and that's where the damage came from, because of the weight of the smoker there should be either two people carrying it or a hand truck. I gave it 4 stars because of the added mods,such as food grade silicone around all connection points, and gaskets around both the smoker door and fire box. Now to the performance, I love my smoker it keeps constant temperature and is a joy to smoke in,however you do need a meat prob so you don't have to keep opening it.
customer_reviews.author: P Ditty 1

customer_reviews.title: Good Smoker but needs Mods to really work
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good smoker with the exception that you need to do modifications to make it work out. As you can see by the photos everywhere you see your redline I had to use the high temp heat silicone to seal off any smoke leakage. For the price the tolerances are except a bowl and of course there are some gaps. But with the use of the silicone sealant you were able to take this from a regular smoker do a very good smoker. Check out YouTube
customer_reviews.author: John A Sklet

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality smoker
customer_reviews.text: The smoker is easy to use, easy to assemble and I've had the temp go as high as 315 when first lighting the fire. The only downside is the thermometer which is not accurate. Most smokers have poor quality thermometers so don't let this minor issue keep you from buying this unit. Overall a great unit especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Miggley

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Great introductory smoker. Quite a bit of smoke leak around door and joints, but easy to just add woodstove gaskets to control. Plenty of room for even a full turkey plus other meats or vegetables. Does take quite a bit of attention if slow-smoking as you're adding soaked wood chips every 40 minutes or so, and taking around 8 hours for most meats. Easy assembly. Biggest downsides are when removing the chip basket, if the tray is not removed at the same time, there's a lot of mess. Other downside is the drip tray doesn't line up well with the drain, and is very small so overflows several times during an 8hour smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this smoker
customer_reviews.text: As a chef, I must say I love this smoker. Guys this smoker is not heavy and easy to use. I literal have better control of the heat then any other smoker I have used. I suggest getting the wide-body smoker so u can cook more meats. It's not that tall but enough room to do whatever u need to do. I wouldn't overpay for this smoker though four hundred is the max.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, not great...
customer_reviews.text: The temperature doesn't spread evenly, making jerky will give you crunchy jerky on one side and on the top shelf, good jerky in the middle and raw meat on the other side. And, as you can see on the photos, smoke and moisture leak from around the thermometer. 😕
customer_reviews.author: witchyhour

customer_reviews.title: I’d shop around, Made in China.
customer_reviews.text: No instructions to assemble or use, but works as it should. After using it, and shopping around, found other ones cheaper at Walmart. This item was made in China. It also had a Chinese candy wrapper stuck to the inside tape, like a kid built it.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I got this smoker for my fiancé’s Birthday 🎂 It was fairly easy to assemble using the book and a You Tube video. He could wait to use it. This is not a light weight smoker. The you tube video used some type of sealer We did not ... He loves it
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: Very well put together
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get my Dyna Glo Wide Body Horizontal Smoker.....the quality is nice!!! It was easy to assemble I followed Steve Pratt Jr. Assembly Instructions on Youtube. I did NOT use the manual at all. It was that easy!! I will be smoking this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Euton

customer_reviews.title: very nice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I am new to this cooking style. Its well made and very easy to use . FYI You don't need to fill basket with charcoil to get the accurate temperature . it actually makes it cook at a higher temperature than required.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars do to Packing  the manufacturd packing is a litle subpar alowing.....
customer_reviews.text: packing is a little subpar allowing the product to be damaged in shipping. my first order arrived crushed across the top of the smoker from front to back! once the replacement arrived. {note this took 2 attempts do to UPS losing the first replacement.} I am totally satisfied with this smoker. 100% as advertised.. I did take the time to seal all seams and mounting points with high temp food grade silicone. to avoid smoke and heat leaks. I love this smoker and would highly recommend it to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Gardner

customer_reviews.title: I think it's gonna be great!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this a couple days ago. This is the biggest smoker I've ever had. It'll take a little getting used to. It's got a couple leaks, but nothing too serious. I should have put some silicone between the fire box and smoke box during assembly. I added a temp gauge about 15" from the bottom, and they read about 30° different. I've read a review about putting a heat shield in the bottom. I'll try that next time. The Pam in the picture is just for reference. Over all, I think it's gonna be great!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday, 20 minutes to assemble. I did seal the outside seam between the fire box and the smoke chamber with food safe silicone. And added a seal to the smoke chamber door. Seasoned it this morning. It held 225 +/-15 for about 3 hours with no effort. Holds temp better than my horizontal smoker and my bullet smoker. It was suppose to replace my bullet smoker but it might replace both.
customer_reviews.author: Schwarziemom

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Ive been smoking meats for about 5 years now. I love this thing. I bought it primarily to make jerky, snack sticks, and smoke cheese. You can get the temps low enough to do these things and they taste wonderful. I also will do a brisket or whole chickens...you can get the temp high enough for this as well. Good deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works, but my father is out of control now
customer_reviews.text: Works great, dad's been using it at least once a week since I got it about a year or two ago. No quarrels, gonna need a bigger one in the future though because his obsession with smoked meats has been growing steadily since he got this and I'm worried he'll try to fit an entire flock of chickens in it or something.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Was going to throw away, the junk man took it
customer_reviews.text: Only half of the holes lined up to assemble Gave it away to metal worker who could clamp , drill, weld. I thought it was a piece of trash and was going to throw away. Worse 160 I ever spent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Dyna-Glo DGO1890BDC-D Wide Body Vertical Offset Charcoal Smoker
product_meta.description: Size:Wide| Style:Smoker| Color:BlackThe Dyna-Glo Wide Body Vertical Offset Charcoal Smoker – DGO1890BDC-D offers quality, performance, and durability. It offers 1,890 square inches of total cooking space. The offset functionality of the smoker keeps direct heat away from food to give an even distribution of heat and smoke. The primary door features a pre-installed seal that retains heat and minimizes heat and smoke loss and provides improved smoke efficiency. The smoker offers cooking versatility with pre-installed sausage hooks and removable chrome-plated rib racks to give you a variety of cooking options. So whether you’re cooking turkey, meat, fish or vegetables, this smoker can handle it all. Take your grilling to the next level with the Dyna-Glo Wide Body Vertical Offset Charcoal Smoker – DGO1890BDC-D
feature_bullets: Six height-adjustable cooking grates accommodate various sizes of food, giving 1890 square inches of total cooking space with 25-pounds capacity per grate.
Porcelain-enameled steel charcoal chamber is designed to keep briquettes stacked tightly for improved burn efficiency.
Charcoal and ash management system with charcoal chamber, grate and sliding, removable steel ash pan. Designed to handle large amounts of ash for hours of maintenance-free cooking
Vertical design lends itself to naturally rising heat, achieving greater efficiency and improved smoke flavor. Offset design keeps direct heat away from the food, allowing for slow cooking.
Smoke stack features an adjustable flue for additional flavor and temperature control.
Built-in, stainless steel thermometer. ‘Smoke Zone’ indicates ideal temperature for infusing smoke flavor and an easy-to-read gauge helps you achieve perfectly smoked foods.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,970 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
